Posts.Content: lancepeace, how soon after the radiation treatments do they take a PSA? (last day?) You said, that a nadir + 2.0 is considered a recurrence. While waiting for my treatment today, there was a fellow having the same treatment for his prostate cancer......he said, both his brothers had radiation for prostate cancer (45 treatments each). One brother, 3 years ago and the other 2 1/2 years ago. Their PSA's are now running a 4 and 3.9. That does not sound good if the nadir should be 2.0. He said they were doing fine with their follow up MRI's. BeeMan
Posts.Title: What can I expect after 18 beam Radiation Treatments and should I get regular PSA tes

Posts.Content: Thanks for clearing that up.....still new to all this. BeeMan
Posts.Title: What can I expect after 18 beam Radiation Treatments and should I get regular PSA tes

Posts.Content: Thanks for clearing that up.....still new to all this. BeeMan
Posts.Title: What can I expect after 18 beam Radiation Treatments and should I get regular PSA tes

Posts.Content: LIBMRDUCKS, it is hard to feel rested when you have to get up 5-6 times a night to urinate. I will have my 24th IMRT/TomoTherapy treatment today......then 15 to go! My radiation oncologist suggested taking Tylenol PM at night to relax the bladder and it seems to help. I only take one (feel a little fogged out in the morning) but now I only get up 3 times a night. I plan to have regular PSA's after treatment. BeeMan

Posts.Title: What can I expect after 18 beam Radiation Treatments and should I get regular PSA tes

Posts.Content: I have a friend that had a prostatectomy in 2000 and his PSA has continued to rise over the years. He now has a PSA of 1.8. He just came into town to meet with my radiation oncologist and is planning to have adjuvant radiation therapy in Sept. after the MRI and bone scan. The prognosis looks good because it most likely is confined to the "prostate bed". BeeMan
Posts.Title: PSA creeping up after Da Vinci surgery

Posts.Title: PSA creeping up after Da Vinci surgery

Posts.Content: 5/4/2014: age 67 (1st Biopsy done 04/16/2002 was Negative. Reason for biopsy, elevated PSA 5.30 (04/02/2002) from a PSA 2.8 U/S prostate size 38.6ml Diagnosed at age 65: Active Surveillance 03/05/2012 Gleason 6 (3 & 3) Left Apex <8% positive (small volume of a single core/ low grade cancer) Second Prostate biopsy T1c U/S Prostate size 45.2 ml PSA 6.41 (Free PSA 30) Third biopsy, age 66: Active Surveillance March 20, 2013 Gleason 7 (3 & 4) Second opinion: Gleason 6 (3 & 3) PSA: 6.85 Fourth Prostate biopsy done on (01/16/2014 )because was PSA 9.29 on 12/20/2013: Two core samples came out positive. Left lateral base a Gleason of 7 (3+4) High-grade prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia. Left Lateral Apex: Prostatic Adenecarcinoma, Gleason 7 (4+3) Hormone Therapy started on 02/24/2014: Casodex for one month. ED (a first!) Eligard injection on 03/02/2014 Bone Scan good. MRI of the prostate showed an 8 mm nodular area (lateral left peripheral zone near the mid gland). Prostatic capsule intact. Periprostatic fat, semi vesicles, and periprostatic neurovascular bundle clear. Prostate measures 5.5 x 3.7 x 5.6, volume 57ml. Considered a T1c-T2c IMRT (Tomo-therapy) started on April 28, 2014 for a total of 39 treatments. After the first treatment with radiation, it feels like I have "Radiation Prostatitis". Flomax increased to 2 x day. It has helped, maybe 50%.

AgeInfo.Phrase: PSA 30  Third biopsy  age 66  Active Surveillance March 20  2013

Posts.Title: Radiation Prostatitis (?)

Posts.Content: Today, my radiation oncologist prescribed Tylenol PM to help me sleep since I have been getting up every 2 1/2 hrs. during the night to pee. At the time he suggested it, I did not know Benadryl was used for the sleep aid part. I think antihistamines make peeing worse (stopped my Allegra for allergies). This should help me sleep or REALLY make my prostatitis worse! Have any of you used the Flomax and Tylenol PM together and what was your experience? BeeMan
Posts.Title: Radiation Prostatitis (?)

Posts.Content: TomoTherapy/IMRT: 23 down and 16 more to go! Just finished a 10 day round of Cipro to be on the safe side (prostatitis?) Still pee frequently, urgency, hard to empty my bladder, esp. right after each treatment. Urination and the hot flashes have been my only big issues. I go to bed an hour earlier. No rectal issues/diarrhea. Good spirits and a loving wife! BeeMan
Posts.Title: Radiation side-effects

Posts.Content: Well said Highlander. Wayne, it is time to do something......best of luck!
Posts.Title: SOOOO many mixed messages.

Posts.Content: First of all, thank you HighlanderCFH for moving this thread to where I could find it! OldCH4, I feel your pain since my PSA has been rising after IMRT/HT and I am now wondering what to do, also. I guess the next step for me would be surgery following a new MRI of the prostate. I will not even make an appointment with my radiation oncologist until after my next PSA, which will be May 16th. I am just trying to get my mind right. My PSA is 0.34 this past Feb. 15, 2016. BeeMan

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by newporter BeeMan, If I used all the PSA # starting from 4/11/2002, your PSA doubling time was calculated to be 13 years! However, that is probably not relavent as the early years' PSA were very stable so they should not be used. Starting 9/30/2008 @ a PSA of 2.4, PSA started to creep up, so I re-do the calculation starting from that PSA #, and the answer is: PSA doubling of ~3 years. AS can be a good option if you would like to consider AS. Hope that helps. "AS", meaning Active Surveillance is what my urologist recommends for now. I have my next prostate biopsy Feb. 2013, should know more then!
Posts.Title: Active Surveillance vs. begin treatment?

L lateral base: Gleason of 7 (3+4) L Lateral Apex: Prostatic Adenecarcinoma Gleason 7 (4+3) HT started 02/24/2014: Casodex one month Eligard injection 03/02/2014 & 9/05/2014 Bone Scan good MRI of prostate 8 mm nodular (lateral left peripheral zone near the mid gland) Prostatic capsule intact Periprostatic fat, semi vesicles, periprostatic neurovascular bundle clear T1c-T2c IMRT started 4/28/ 2014 (39 Rx) to June 23, 2014 Hot flashes, fatigue, leg pain, insomnia, body aches, ED PSA < 0.02, testosterone 36 as of May 2015 PSA 08/17/2016 0.44 PSA 8/23/2017 0.59 PSA 2/27/18 0.57 PSA 12/05/2018 0.74 repeat every 6 months
Posts.Title: How to List My Stats in Each of My Posts

Age.Phrase: PSA 30  Third biopsy  age 66  Active Surveillance March 20  2013

DoctorRecommended.Sample: FFF, Do you live in Houston (since you went to MD Anderson for your MRI)? If so, I have a GREAT radiation oncologist I can recommend if they want to go that way for treatment....If so, I have a GREAT radiation oncologist I can recommend if they want to go that way for treatment. BeeMan...Today, my radiation oncologist prescribed Tylenol PM to help me sleep since I have been getting up every 2 1/2 hrs....I will have my 24th IMRT/TomoTherapy treatment today......then 15 to go! My radiation oncologist suggested taking Tylenol PM at night to relax the bladder and it seems to help. I only take one (feel a little fogged out in the morning) but now I only get up 3 times a night....LIBMRDUCKS, it is hard to feel rested when you have to get up 5-6 times a night to urinate. I will have my 24th IMRT/TomoTherapy treatment today......then 15 to go! My radiation oncologist suggested taking Tylenol PM at night to relax the bladder and it seems to help....Today, my radiation oncologist prescribed Tylenol PM to help me sleep since I have been getting up every 2 1/2 hrs. during the night to pee....
